name: Green Bean Salad With Chickpeas and Mushrooms
description: A far cry from cafeteria-style three-bean salad, this fresh, lively dish is a mixture of crunch and softness, bright colors and earth tones.
keywords: chickpea, garbanzo beans, green beans, gluten-free, halal, healthy, high fiber, kosher, low cholesterol, nut-free, vegetarian, spring
recipeIngredient: 3 ounces mushrooms, cleaned, trimmed and sliced thin (about 1 1/4 cups)
2 cups cooked chickpeas, or 1 15-ounce can, drained and rinsed
3 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs, like chives, marjoram, parsley and tarragon
1 small garlic clove, green shoot removed, finely minced or put through a press

recipeInstructions.text: Steam or blanch the green beans for five minutes, then cool in a bowl of ice water. Drain and trim the stems. If the beans are very long, break in half.

Combine the beans, mushrooms, chickpeas, Parmesan and herbs in a salad bowl. In a small bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the lemon juice, vinegar, salt, mustard and garlic. Whisk in the olive oil.
Toss the dressing with the bean mixture shortly before serving. If desired, garnish with red pepper slices or toss them with the salad.
